title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating older people may live in a retirement community for economic reasons.

Two points for explaining that the community may appeal to older people for economic reasons.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following economic reasons why a recently established community might have a population structure for people over the age of 55:
The response correctly states the following economic reason why a recently established community might have a population structure for people over the age of 55:
The response correctly explains one of the following economic reasons why a recently established community might have a population structure for people over the age of 55:

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating a desired climate, a favorable landscape, or a sustainable lifestyle.

Two points for describing that older people may have environmental preferences for hospitable climate, landscape, and outdoor amenities.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following environmental pull factors that would draw migrants from long distances to the location shown:
The response correctly states one of the following environmental pull factors that would draw migrants from long distances to the location shown:
The response correctly explains one of the following environmental pull factors that would draw migrants from long distances to the location shown:

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that women live longer, or men live less long than women.

Two points for explaining the reasons that women may live longer than men; including lower exposure to hazards, less female infant mortality, and less likely to be injured during wartime.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following reasons why the female population aged 65 and over can be significantly larger than the male over age 65 population:
The response correctly states one of the following reasons why the female population aged 65 and over can be significantly larger than the male over age 65 population:
The response correctly explains one of the following reasons why the female population aged 65 and over can be significantly larger than the male over age 65 population:

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that it is a useful, either especially or limited, tool for predicting local need for health care facilities.

Two points for explaining that it is a good predictor of the need for health care services and facilities since older populations have greater health care needs, it is a good predictor of the need for health care services for the limited younger populations, or it is a limited predictor of the need for health care services because it does not provide enough data to fully predict the need for health care services.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following degrees to which the population pyramid shown can be used to predict local needs for health care facilities:
The response correctly states one of the following degrees to which the population pyramid shown can be used to predict local needs for health care facilities:
The response correctly explains one of the following degrees to which the population pyramid shown can be used to predict local needs for health care facilities:
